title: Keen 2 level competition
content:
I have nothing to do, so I may as well do a KeenRush and start a levelpack competition. (Lets have three shall we, one for each episode.)

The rules will be the same as KeenRush's pack, though you may submit multiple levels. (Ha! Like that'll happen.) I of course, shan't enter, but the last set of levels were ingenious beyond all measure and I hope for strong participation in this one.

Anyone interested?

title: Re: Keen 2 level competition
content: Does everyone here have Keen 2 though?  I'd suggest a Keen 4 comp instead, given that it's free to download and there's a much greater challenge over Keen 1.

title: Re: Keen 2 level competition
content:
Given how few people bothered to vote or post something in the end result topic I will certainly not participate.-----------------
[img]http://www.jamster.co.uk/s/jcw/img/logo_jamster_navi.gif[/img][img]http://www.jamster.co.uk/storage/view/335/0/cr/CrazyFrog___Axel_F_Falling.gif[/img]

title: Well...
content:
I agree with the sentiments of both Djaser and Malv... while the project was good fun, the response was lacking, and the timing of a second competition may be a bit premature.

Why not give things a month to settle, and start this competition on 3/14? The interim would give you time to piece together ground rules, a tutorial on how to get TED5 functional with/without DOSBox, and prepare an FAQ for making sure Carmackization works and the levels load without error.

A Keen4 level competition would be a great way to introduce the community to Keen4+ Modding, without the headache/pressure of a full-fledged mod. I say let's go for it!

title: Re: Well...
content:
Ah, 3 replies and 15 views, I submit.

I don't know how to do any of that at all Xky, I'll just let this die.
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v499/Nevad/menbun.gif[/img]

Cute bunny!

title: Re: Keen 2 level competition
content:
Djaser: Given how few people bothered to vote or post something in the end result topic I will certainly not participate.

I thought the idea was to test your level making skills against other modders, I wouldn't have thought it mattered what anyone else thought...

And Xky, I like the sound of the tutorials - if there was one that explained all the 'gotchas' like you mention I'd probably have a go at level modding too (I've always preferred the Galaxy series over Vorticons.)

title: Re: Keen 2 level competition
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]I thought the idea was to test your level making skills against other modders, I wouldn't have thought it mattered what anyone else thought...[hr][/quote]
Of course it does. You can argue the clich that you have to make a level for your own and not for everyone else. But hey, if this is so than why would you bother to upload your level. Why would you call a project a competition? The answer is obvious; to show everyone what you made. Because you cant know who exactly notice your work you have to do it with the replies you receive. And thats where comes a not so obvious question in: why would you bother to upload anything if your work more or less gets ignored?
We got a level pack with 16 levels by 16 different people but the amount of people voting doesnt rise above ten and the people replies to the end result topic hardly half of that. How lame is that? What the competition worth this way? I know I tend to get quickly disappointed by people but this is yet another slap in the face. It confirms my opinion about the lacking attitude of most Keeners, something thats a danger for such a small community.
-----------------
[img]http://www.jamster.co.uk/s/jcw/img/logo_jamster_navi.gif[/img][img]http://www.jamster.co.uk/storage/view/335/0/cr/CrazyFrog___Axel_F_Falling.gif[/img]

title: Re: Keen 2 level competition
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]We got a level pack with 16 levels by 16 different people[hr][/quote]

Doesn't that alone show that there was interest? And I can't speak for anyone else, but the reason I didn't vote was because I couldn't complete any levels besides mine and I'm bad at assessing the relative quality of things anyway.

And I was all ready to participate in this competition until I saw it'd been canceled/changed to Keen 4 one. I've made attempts to make Keen 4 levels in the past, but it seems you can get all sorts of bugs...------------------
www.ericmushroomwilson.co.uk My website is going to go back online
[url=http://ericmushroom.livejournal.com/]My stupid journal thing[/url]

title: Complicated
content:
Yeah, I don't think I'd ever be able to edit Keen 4; it's exponentially harder than Keen 1-3 and I don't think we'll get near 16 levels from a Keen 4 competition.

Will Windows Keen work without the executable? Then we could provide a legal download for anyone without Keen 2.

title: Re: Complicated
content:
If the worst comes to the worst, we could always just place the levels and .bat file in a zip when uploading.

I think we should do the episodes in order; this also has the advantage of people having more time to get used to keen4-6 level editing.

---Freeyorp

title: Hehe
content:
Everyone's afraid of making the leap--we've had the CAPABILITY to make Keen4 mods since 3/14/04, haven't we? It'll be the 3 year anniversary of ModKeen2.0 this year, and we've only had one full-fledged Keen4 mod, by Ceilick, and a few one-level specials (Birdman demo and Benvolio's OneLevelMod)...

How much longer are we gonna wait? It's really a shame that ShadowMaster had to take a leave for a while--he would have been a primary candidate for preparing Tutorials... he helped me overcome a few obstacles and even get TED5 working on my machine!

As I work more on my Keen4 mod, I will pay attention to the steps taken to get things working, so that I can help others do the same. I just wish ShadowMaster was around, so I could ask him for help when I need it.. haha

title: Re: Hehe
content:
Yeah, I second that there'd be a little more time till a new level contest was started. I'm sure people want to have one, at least I was asked by a few already when the first one was running whether there'll be a second one later.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Hehe
content:
It's not really that I'm afraid of making the leap - hell, there are elements in Keen 4 levels that'd be really interesting to play around with.

It's just that as far as I remember from the last time I tried, Keen Galaxy modding is much fiddlier. You can get errors where levels won't load and things like that.

But I'm up for giving it a try, I guess, if I can get Ted5 to work on my computer.------------------

title: hmm
content:
Okay, if we're gonna have the pack released to the public in time for 3/14, which is now less than a month away, we'd better start the presses rolling right now.

Let's set some ground rules. The Keen1 competition was to create "an old-school Keen level" which included "no map tiles" and tried to be "as Keen as possible." Do those rules sound good for Keen2 as well? It had a distinctly different way of putting itself together--less outright exploration, more columns and clearly-defined walls...

Are we designing levels with or without Tantalus Rays? Are we allowing the use of lightswitches? Are we allowing use of the Vorticon Elder bubbles? Will Keen start each level with no ammo?

Let's get some decisions made, a thread created, and someone (Levelass? KR?) can start collecting levels.

Levelass, I'm always willing to help betatest stuff--just be sure it actually gets to my mailbox! The last thing you asked me to help with never actually got to me--and I checked the junkmail folder and everything!

content:
Okay then. I shall attempt to participate. Like a precipitate.------------------

title: Re: hmm
content:
Thats too bad you guys couldn't get the editor working, I don't know what to say [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img]

The ground rules used in the last contest listed by Xky sound good.

I think we should definately allow Tantalus Rays. Most of the keen 2 levels were built around the Tantalus Rays, kind of like a climax for the level. Keen 2 just wouldn't be keen 2 without them, whereas keen 1 is still keen 1 without the ship parts. All we need is a patch that changes the amount of tantalus rays needed to be shot (set it like 1 more than the amount of levels perhaps).

Light switches and vorticon elders should be optional (I had a yorp message in my keen 1 level, even though there was no message for it).

title: Yay!
content:
I volunteer to collect levels, KeenRush has had his fun!

I say we shouldn't use the Elders, there's only two of them, where would they go? As for the Tantalus rays, I suppose we could use them, they can go into any level, but then yo could exit without playing all of the levels. I'm against them. (But not their tiles, on the other hand, Ceilick has made a very good suggestion, make it impossible to win.) Let's use the lightswitches, they're harmless.

I've been spelling 'ceilick' "ceclick" for my entire stay here, so, it seems, has Adis, nobody noticed...

Let's get some levels built!

title: Two outta three aint bad...
content:
Only 12 I'm afraid, but that looks to be everyone there is. (And 12/16 = 3/4, which beats 2/3)

So without further ado I present the Commander Keen Community Keen Day Keen 2 Level Pack (CKCKDLP)

[url=http://levellord.toxicsheep.com/Keenstuff/Keen%20Day%20Levelpack.zip]levellord.toxicsheep.com/...elpack.zip[/url]

Don't forget to vote for your favourate levels! Levels are numbered thusly; a gold block by the level is +4; a red block +1; much like in the Keen 1 competition.


1.) Most Keenish; the level that best capturs that feeling of playing Keen 2 all over again for the first time.

2.) Elite: That level that's so damn hard, huge or complex you just wanna smack your head against the screen and burst into tears.

3.) Scrubbed; that level that was the most fun or easiest to get through. We're talking putting on cruise control, turning up the radio and enjoying here.

title: Those categories again
content:
[hr]Levelass wrote:
1.) Most Keenish: the level that best captures that feeling of playing Keen 2 all over again for the first time.

2.) Elite: That level that's so damn hard, huge or complex you just wanna smack your head against the screen and burst into tears.

3.) Scrubbed: that level that was the most fun or easiest to get through. We're talking putting on cruise control, turning up the radio and enjoying here.[hr][url=http://toxicsheep.com]toxicsheep.com[/url] | [url=http://commanderkeen.org]coming up next...[/url]
